(2)
You are my only son. The schedule below is filed The property is a property registered in my name in Book 1, Volume 1295, Pages 72 and 73, Sri Narasapuram, S.R.A., as per the settlement deed registered in my name on 09-10-1986, and is in my complete possession and enjoyment till date. I have transferred the property as per the said schedule, out of my love for you, for your well-being, and in return for my love for you, I should provide you with some tangible immovable property. With the intention that I give you the property listed below for a value of Rs. 12,34,000/- free of charge and hereby relinquish all my rights in the said property and transfer all rights in your name and take possession of the property listed in the schedule to you on this day with all rights. You shall, by making repairs and development works on the said property from this amount and by paying all the revenue, panchayat taxes etc. payable to the Government, enjoy the said property freely and happily with all the rights of donation, exchange, sale and possession of the same as you wish. Please be informed about this. I will, at my own expense, settle all disputes, disputes, etc., arising from any cause whatsoever, whether by me or my heirs, or by you or your heirs, and execute this deed without any dispute or controversy.
Desandri Krishna Murthitalu
!19th day of March,2022

I hereby declare that I have not previously registered any I hereby declare that the property is undisputed and free from any encumbrances such as mortgages, charges, guarantees, loans, court seizures, etc., and that the said property is in my complete possession and enjoyment till date, that the survey number, boundary, door number and boundaries of the said property are correct, that there are no previous tax arrears on the said property. If so, I am able to pay all of them myself, and I hereby give you this deed in your name. This is not a property assigned by the Government under the A.P. State Act No. 9/77. There are no other heirs or beneficiaries to this property except me. I hereby submit a notice to the Government for the registration of your name in the accounts. I hereby furnish you with a copy of the above mentioned settlement deed in my name for the said property. Declaration: - As per the schedule below, there is no stamp duty payable on the property except the items mentioned in Annexure 1A. If found to be so, I am able to pay the depreciation charge imposed by the Government. Challan Details: - On 19-03-2022, I have deposited stamp duty of Rs. 24,680/-, registration fee of Rs. 6,170/- and user charge of Rs. 210/- as under. The amount of Rs.31,060/- has been paid in cash and the challans are enclosed herewith.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 1659 of 2022, dated 19/Mar/2022, executed by Devireddi Krishnamurthy in favour of his Son, Devireddy Pola Basakarao, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 242 Sq.Yds., (or) 2178 Sq.Fts., bearing house number 4-74, Assessment no.878, comprised in survey number 588/1, situated in Vemuladeevi Gram Panchayat & Revenue Village, Narsapuram Mandal within the District of West Godavari registered at sub-registrar office Narsapur is bounded as follows: North by: R & B Road South by: House Site of Chamakuri Durga Prasad East by: House Site of Kotla Nagamalleswara Rao West by: House Site Devireddy Chinakondala Rao

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property bearing house number 4-74, Assessment no.878, comprised in survey number 588/1, situated in Vemuladeevi Revenue Village, measuring about 242 Sq.Yds., (or) 2178 Sq.Fts., was originally owned by Devireddi Krishnamurthy, who acquired the property through Gift Settlement Deed, vide.doc.no.2107 of 1986. [Ref: Deed ] 2. The aforementioned, Devireddi Krishnamurthy executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 19/Mar/2022, registered as document No. 1659 of 2022, before the SRO Narsapur favour of his Son, Devireddy Pola Basakarao, towards the property measuring 242 Sq.Yds., (or) 2178 Sq.Fts., bearing house number 4-74, Assessment no.878, comprised in survey number. 588/1, situated in Vemuladeevi village. 3. The aforementioned Devireddy Pola Basakarao executed a Mortgage Deed on 22/Aug/2022, registered as document No. 5004 of 2022, before the SRO Narsapur in favour of M/s. Five Star Business Finance LTD, Bhimavaram, towards the property measuring 242 Sq.Yds., (or) 2178 Sq.Fts., situated in Vemuladeevi village. [Ref: EC] Note: It is to be noted that Mortgage Document No. 5004 of 2022, is currently active with M/s. Five Star Business Finance LTD, Bhimavaram. Upon inquiry with the F.I., they reverted to release a conditional report. Therefore, it is advisable to obtain a Receipt Deed before proceeding with the loan disbursement. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : Note: It has been noted that the HTR was not attached in this case. When the same is enquired with F.I. they reverted to release a conditional report. It is advisable to F.I. obtain HTR prior to the loan disbursement of the loan.
The mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner Devireddy Pola Basakarao.

sections.content: We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the Devireddy Pola Basakarao, possesses a clear & valid title to the property measuring 242 Sq.Yds., (or) 2178 Sq.Fts., bearing house number 4-74, Assessment no.878, comprised in survey number 588/1, situated in Vemuladeevi Gram Panchayat & Revenue Village, Narsapuram Mandal within the District of West Godavari registered at sub-registrar office Narsapur. Subject to discharge active mortgage vide.doc.no.5004 of 2022.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
